climbs.name: Scales
climbs.fa: Harvey T. Carter; modernized by Bob Wade & Dave Clark

content.description: Pull and step on soft Gold Butte sandstone to a slot at half height. Style, or thrutch, through the slot to a testy foot traverse. Easier climbing leads to the anchor.
content.protection: About 7 bolts (plus a couple of Harvey Carter's drilled pins for optional clipping) and a two bolt anchor with 'biners.
content.location: It is the farthest route on the left of the buttress with glue-ins.

content.description:
Step and pull on soft, overhanging Gold Butte sandstone huecos through a final bulge. Traverse left on a ramp to finish with the top of the same chossy crack as on

Mindbender

. This is a steeper, softer, harder, cooler version of

Hero Loop

. One could hope that it will clean up with traffic; but realistically, I doubt it, and maybe that's part of its attraction.
content.protection:
About 6 bolts, a #1 Camalot for the top of the chossy crack, and a shared anchor with

Mindbender

.
content.location:
This is ten feet right of

Mindbender

.

content.description: Pull and step on soft Gold Butte sandstone to a short, right-facing dihedral. Surmount it, and head up a chossy crack to a two bolt anchor with 'biners.
content.protection: Maybe 5 bolts and a #1 Camalot for the top of the chossy crack.
content.location:
It is immediately right of

Scales

.
